Trial_Design.evidence: patients aged 18–60 years with a BMI of 50–60 kg/m 2 were allocated randomly

Participants.evidence: patients aged 18–60 years with a BMI of 50–60 kg/m 2

Intervention.evidence: standard (150 cm alimentary, 50 cm biliopancreatic limb) or distal (150 cm common channel, 50 cm biliopancreatic limb) RYGB

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome (change in BMI at 2 years) has been reported previously.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between May 2011 and April 2013, 123 patients were randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: 113 received an intervention, and 92 attended 5-year follow-up

Result_Outcome.evidence: BMI was reduced by 15.1 (95 per cent c.i. 13.9 to 16.2) kg/m 2 after standard and 15.7 (14.5 to 16.9) kg/m 2 after distal RYGB; the between-group difference was −0.64 (−2.3 to 1.0) kg/m 2 ( P = 0.447)

Harms.evidence: Vitamin A and vitamin D levels were lower after distal RYGB.
